channel.title: Babylon Burning
channel.description: <p>Babylon Burning specializes in reggae music, both new and old. The first hour typically concentrates on classic reggae - from the Jamaican rocksteady of the late 60s, through the roots and rockers era of the 70s, to the foundation dancehall sounds of the early 80s - while the second hour focuses on more contemporary sounds and new releases.</p>

item.title: Just too deep
item.description: <p><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:aptos,aptos_embeddedfont,aptos_msfontservice,calibri,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:12pt">Featuring the new release "Children of ~war~ Hope" from Australian label Shades of Red, Royal Blu's new album "Spain Root", new music from Lutan Fyah, Dahvid Slur, Perfect Giddimani, Pressure Busspipe &amp; Young Shanty... plus some First Nations reggae, and the usual vintage classics.</span></p>
item.author: Jesse I

item.title: Babylon Burning presented by Sista Itations
item.author: Jesse I

item.title: give the children food
item.description: <p><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:aptos,aptos_embeddedfont,aptos_msfontservice,calibri,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:12pt">Paying respect to Jamaican music legend Owen Gray; Pacific music legend George "Fiji" Veikoso; and Aotearoa producer, beat maker and founding member of Fat Freddy's Drop, Chris Ta’aloga Faiumu (aka DJ Mu, aka DJ Fitchie). </span></p>
item.author: Jesse I

item.title: I burn
item.description: <p><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:aptos,aptos_embeddedfont,aptos_msfontservice,calibri,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:12pt">Paying respect to Jamaican producer and engineer Sheldon “Cali Bud” Stewart (1977-2025). Plus some fire and brimstone roots, rockers and early reggae.</span></p>
item.author: Jesse I

item.title: burn it to the ground
item.description: <p><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:aptos,aptos_embeddedfont,aptos_msfontservice,calibri,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:12pt">Featuring a heap of great new reggae including Yeza's excellent album "Star Of The East", and new tunes from Irie Souljah, Kabaka Pyramid, Lutan Fyah, Rik Jam, Medisun, Tarrus Riley, Joe Yorke, Cham, and Damian &amp; Stephen Marley... plus a mix of recent dancehall releases including Runkus, Ding Dong, Busy Signal, Lila Ike, Masicka, Mr Vegas, and nuff more.</span></p>
item.author: Jesse I

item.title: creation rebel
item.description: <p><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:aptos,aptos_embeddedfont,aptos_msfontservice,calibri,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:12pt">Featuring the new album <em>The Genesis</em> from Jamaican singer Rik Jam, more from Yeza's new album <em>Star of the East</em>, Tippa Lee &amp; Naram's album <em>Musically Bad,</em> and new music from UK-based singer Haile. Plus some late 80s and early 90s throwbacks, and the usual 70s and early 80s classics.</span></p>
item.author: Jesse I

item.title: love in a lovely way
item.description: <p><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:aptos,aptos_embeddedfont,aptos_msfontservice,calibri,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:12pt">Featuring Lila Iké's new album <em>Treasure Self Love </em>and some of the songs which inspired it; Blaqk Sheep Music's new riddim <em>Country Man</em>;<em> </em>new tunes from Rik Jam, Kelissa, Medisun, Daniel Rising &amp; Jemere Morgan; Australian releases from Belly &amp; Jahwise and Mista Savona; a look at fake 70s AI-generated reggae music; and the usual vintage classics.</span></p>
item.author: Jesse I

item.title: blxxd and fyah
item.description: <p><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:aptos,aptos_embeddedfont,aptos_msfontservice,calibri,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:12pt">Featuring new albums from Keznamdi, Jesse Royal and Zamunda... new tunes from Mortimer, Skip Marley, Rayvon, Jhazahra, Tom Spirals &amp; Dub Princess... a version excursion on the Heptones Gonna Fight (aka Fight It To The Top) riddim... and the usual vintage classics.</span></p>
item.author: Jesse I

item.title: hell a go pop
item.description: <p><span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family:aptos,aptos_embeddedfont,aptos_msfontservice,calibri,helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:12pt">Featuring the riddim <em>Hell A Go Pop</em> from Irie Ites, and classic reggae riddims <em>None A Jah Jah Children</em> and <em>Promised Land</em>; Johnny Osbourne's new album <em>Universal Love Showcase</em>; new tunes from Cheizdek, Randy Valentine, Kimeco, Roe Summerz &amp; Boostive; and the usual foundation classics. </span></p>
item.author: Jesse I
